intro: Deinandra corymbosa, commonly known as the sweet pea bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to lilac-colored blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branched. Deinandra corymbosa is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
